value.title: Fox News Host Confronts Mick Mulvaney Over 'Trump Will Concede Gracefully' Op-Ed
value.excerpt: "I've seen the president be presidential before…but something is very different now," said the former acting White House chief of staff.

value.title: Reps. Paul Gosar, Andy Biggs credited in video with organizing Trump crowd in DC on day of riot
value.excerpt: The man who has led the "Stop the Steal" protests nationally singles out Reps. Paul Gosar and Andy Biggs for helping make Washington gathering happen.

value.title: Forbes editor issues warning to companies intending to hire Trump officials: 'We'll assume everything you talk about is a lie'
value.excerpt: The editor of Forbes magazine has warned companies not to hire Kellyanne Conway, Sean Spicer, Kayleigh McEnany, Stephanie Grisham, or Sarah Sanders.

value.title: 'Immediate removal' of President Trump: Full Hakeem Jeffries Interview
value.excerpt: In an exclusive interview with Meet the Press, Rep. Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.), Chair, House Democratic Caucus, talks to Chuck Todd about the Democrats' impeachment plans.

value.title: Top Republican says Trump committed 'impeachable offenses'
value.excerpt: Democrats' momentum for a fresh drive to quickly impeach outgoing President Donald Trump has gained support, and a top Republican said the president's role in the deadly riot at the Capitol by a violent mob of Trump supporters was worthy of rebuke.

value.title: Donald Trump Jr.: ‘We are living Orwell’s 1984’ after dad outed from Twitter
value.excerpt: Free-speech no longer exists in America. It died with big tech and what’s left is only there for a chosen few. This is absolute insanity!” he tweeted in response to the news.

value.title: Theresa May too eager to pay homage to Donald Trump, says John Bercow
value.excerpt: PM’s ‘almost breathless’ quest to develop ties with US president

value.title: Former Goldman Sachs CEO Lloyd Blankfein slams Wall Street traders as Trump enablers
value.excerpt: Lloyd Blankfein said Wall Street put up with Trump because of what he could deliver, which was mainly lower corporate taxes and fewer regulations.

value.title: Family: Trump supporter who died followed QAnon conspiracy
value.excerpt: Friends and relatives say a Georgia woman killed in Wednesday’s siege of the U.S. Capitol was a recovering drug addict who wanted to become a sobriety counselor

value.title: Hillary Clinton, Chrissy Teigen, Megyn Kelly and more famous faces react to Trump's Twitter ban
value.excerpt: Here's what Meghan McCain, Megyn Kelly, Chrissy Teigen and other celebrities are saying about Trump's permanent suspension from Twitter.

value.title: Twitter permanently suspends Trump's account to prevent 'further incitement of violence'
value.excerpt: Company determines two Friday tweets were ‘highly likely’ to encourage behavior like the storming of the Capitol

value.title: Coming clean: I made an error in my otherwise 'admirable' column on Donald Trump
value.excerpt: In my column Wednesday I wondered how President Donald Trump could possibly rate as America’s most admired man in a recent Gallup Poll when he exhibited only

value.title: Pelosi asks Joint Chiefs about preventing Trump from launching nukes
value.excerpt: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi spoke with the nation's top military officer on Friday about precautions in place to prevent President Donald Trump from ordering a nuclear strike or conducting other military hostilities as Democrats seek his removal from office.

value.title: Ashli Babbitt, rioter fatally shot in DC, was ‘bananas’ over Trump: grandfather
value.excerpt: The Air Force veteran who was fatally shot as she stormed the Capitol was an “excellent patriot” who was a fanatic follower of President Trump, her grandfather said. Ashli Babbitt, 35, of San

value.title: Trump's billionaire backers are 'horrified' by the insurrection at the Capitol but only one has broken with him
value.excerpt: More than 100 billionaires have donated to Donald Trump's political campaigns. Few of them are willing to speak out regarding the US Capitol attack.

value.title: Elaine Chao, Betsy DeVos step down from Trump Cabinet following Capitol storming
value.excerpt: Transportation Secretary Elaine Chao became the first Trump Cabinet member to resign in the wake of Wednesday's storming of the Capitol by the president's supporters.

value.title: WSJ Opinion: Trump Erases His Legacy
value.excerpt: A politician has to work hard to destroy a legacy and a future in a single day. President Donald J. Trump managed it. Image: John Minchillo/Assoc

value.title: Capitol riots: Boris Johnson condemns Donald Trump for sparking events
value.excerpt: Donald Trump was "completely wrong" to cast doubt on the US election and encourage supporters to storm the Capitol, Boris Johnson has said. The UK prime minister said he "unreservedly condemns" the US president's actions.

value.title: Book of the moment: ‘Audience of One: Donald Trump, Television, and the Fracturing of America’
value.excerpt: For a deeper understanding of this week's insurrection at the Capitol and the end of Donald Trump's presidency, read "Audience of One: Donald Trump, Television, and the Fracturing of America" by James Poniewozik.

value.title: Top CEOs may cut off funding to Republicans who have supported Trump's election challenge: 'Money is the key way'
value.excerpt: Execs from Disney, Accenture, and Deloitte, as well as former White House advisors, attended a call to discuss Trump's election challenge.

value.title: 'We Are All Joe Scarborough:' MSNBC Host Praised For F-Word Rant On Trump Rioters
value.excerpt: Scarborough on Thursday called for the arrest of Trump and others in a profanity-laced rant that went viral President Trump has been criticized for inciting violence and was temporarily banned from Twitter Scarborough received support on social media for his comments MSBNC host Joe Scarborough drew praise Thursday for an unfiltered commentary about the mob that raided Capitol.

value.title: During Electoral College debate, U.S. Sens. Tammy Duckworth and Richard Durbin condemn Trump and violent mob that stormed U.S. Capitol
value.excerpt: U.S. Sens. Tammy Duckworth and Richard Durbin condemn Trump and violent mob that stormed U.S. Capitol in floor speeches on Electoral College debate.

value.title: Hollywood Condemns Violence Of Trump Supporters, Calls Them 'Domestic Terrorists'
value.excerpt: Notable personalities such as Sacha Baron Cohen, Ava DuVernay, Michael Keaton, Selena Gomez and many more expressed their anger amid the riots that took place in Washington, D.C. where the protesters breached the U.

value.title: Facebook indefinitely blocks Trump from accessing his account
value.excerpt: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the platform is blocking his Facebook and Instagram accounts "indefinitely" and for at least the next two weeks.

value.title: Trump tells backers to ‘go home’ after Capitol stormed
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump urged supporters who stormed the Capitol to “go home” but also kept up false attacks about the presidential election

value.title: Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer call on Trump to demand protestors to leave the US Capitol 'immediately'
value.excerpt: The joint statement came as President Donald Trump reportedly refused to listen to aides who advised he put out a stronger statement against the rioters.

value.title: The Cybersecurity 202: The Trump administration formally says Russia is likely behind SolarWinds hack culprit. Will Trump?
value.excerpt: The Trump administration formally accused Russia of “likely” being behind the most devastating hack of U.S. government agencies in years. The statement, made jointly by four agencies in charge of intelligence and cybersecurity,

value.title: Trump-Biden transition live updates: Pence told Trump he doesn't have power to reverse election
value.excerpt: During their weekly lunch Tuesday, Vice President Mike Pence told President Donald Trump he does not have the power to reverse the outcome of the November election when he preside

value.title: Video shows Romney being called "traitor" by Trump fans while on flight
value.excerpt: Senator Mitt Romney of Utah faced chants of "traitor" while on a flight from Salt Lake City to Washington, D.C. A video posted to Twitter appears to show a small group of passengers chanting, at least one of whom appears to not be properly wearing a mask.

value.title: Trump signs order banning transactions with Chinese apps Alipay and WeChat Pay
value.excerpt: Taking his campaign against Chinese technology down to the wire, President Trump on Tuesday signed an executive order banning transactions with a number of Chinese mobile apps, including Alipay and WeChat Pay.
